info.game_comments:
2008 College Championship final game 2.
From the Kohl Center at the University of Wisconsin-Madison.

(1, 1).clue: Only 3 cities in this state have more than 50,000 people--Billings, Missoula & Great Falls

(2, 1).clue: In Mark 1, the Holy Spirit came to Jesus like this bird

(3, 1).clue: In 1903 the first pack of this brand carried the line "for educational color work"

(4, 1).clue: This part of an egg gets its name from the Old English for "yellow"

(5, 1).clue: Ellen Pompeo plays one of the healers in training on this drama

(6, 1).clue: Catherine, Anne, Jane, Anne No. 2, Catherine H. & Catherine P. try to avoid elimination in "Who Wants to Marry" this king

(1, 2).clue: Not surprisingly, it has the largest economy of any state, with the highest revenue & the highest expenditures

(2, 2).clue: Lot fled this city as God burned it behind him

(3, 2).clue: In 1899 this pair started their research with a biplane flown like a kite

(4, 2).clue: This season gets its name from the Sanskrit for "half year"

(5, 2).clue: Kyle MacLachlan moved onto Wisteria Lane as Orson Hodge, Bree's new husband, on this soapy series

(6, 2).clue: Not feeling so tolerant lately?  Become Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's successor as this country's "Next Top Despot"

(1, 3).clue: This state could use some crowd control: it's the most populous state in the Midwest

(2, 3).clue: This king got angry & killed all the babies in Bethlehem

(3, 3).clue: Title of the chief of the DOJ

(4, 3).clue: The opposite of nadir, it's from the Arabic for "road above"

(5, 3).clue: Jorge Garcia keeps the humor alive as Hugo "Hurley" Reyes on this enigmatic show

(6, 3).clue: On "Dancing with Ex-George W. Bush Cabinet Members", this ex-Defense Sec. goes on the offensive--with a sizzling samba!

(1, 4).clue: The name of this state is Spanish for "colored red"

(2, 4).clue: On this festival, Galileans could suddenly talk like Parthians & Medes

(3, 4).clue: Used in martial arts, this hand weapon, 2 sticks joined by a cord or chain, is also called karate sticks

(4, 4).clue: The name of this element is from the Latin word for "lime", the chemical kind

(5, 4).clue: Who can resist John Krasinski as prankster Jim Halpert on this sitcom?

(6, 4).clue: The fork's now in your hand in "So You Think You Can Eat an Entire" this make of auto, whether Cayenne or Boxster

(1, 5).clue: A bus boycott in this state in 1955 helped launch the civil rights movement

(2, 5).clue: King Saul didn't let his people eat until they destroyed these enemies

(3, 5).clue: (Kelly of the Clue Crew indicates a diagram on the monitor.) Instead of running around the curve, save strides & run this straight line that touches the curve, from the Latin for "to touch"

(4, 5).clue: The name of this musical instrument comes from Greek words for "wood" and "voice"

(5, 5).clue: Jack Coleman, who plays the mysterious H.R.G. on this show, is a descendant of Benjamin Franklin

(6, 5).clue: Oops!  Rex finds out the hard way this body part's neocortex is nowhere near the groin in "I Wanna Be a Surgeon!"

(1, 1).clue: In 1932 he became the first defeated vice presidential candidate of a major party elected president

(2, 1).clue: (Adam Sandler delivers the clue.) The name of my production company, Happy Madison, comes from the titles of these 2 movies I starred in

(3, 1).clue: Nausea & extreme sensitivity to light & sound often accompany one of these severe headaches

(4, 1).clue: Ooh!  Ballerinas in green tutus!  My favorite part of the ballet "Jewels" is named for these green gems

(5, 1).clue: Menkaure is our cry!  He will crush the Sinai!  Ra!  Ra!  Ra!

(6, 1).clue: "Snizzle" is not a Snoop Dogg term but a weather word for the mixture of these 2 conditions

(1, 2).clue: With wife Rosalynn, he wrote the book "Everything To Gain: Making the Most Out of the Rest of Your Life"

(2, 2).clue: (Adam delivers the clue again.) Drew Barrymore has problems remembering the name of this 2004 movie we starred in that's set in Hawaii

(3, 2).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew explains a diagram of the human eye.)  In the normal eye, the focal point of light is on the retina; in hypermitropia, it's behind the retina; in this opposite condition, it's in front of the retina

(4, 2).clue: I have to see the NYCB's production of this; the Christmas tree grows about 40 feet high & weighs a ton!

(5, 2).clue: We once were Gran, but we're still not bad.  From Cartagena to Soledad, hail...

(6, 2).clue: A "hall walker" is someone who has little to do in this Department of Defense HQ

(1, 3).clue: 2 of his 4 sons served as state governors: one in Florida, one in Texas

(2, 3).clue: (Adam Sandler delivers the clue.)  In my new movie "You Don't Mess With The Zohan", I play an intelligence agent from this country founded in 1948 who fakes his death to be a hairdresser

(3, 3).clue: Blood tests that measure vitamin B12 levels are used to diagnose the pernicious form of this

(4, 3).clue: No way!  Way!  Act II, Scene One of "Spartacus" is set on this ancient highway

(5, 3).clue: Hail our banners red flying overhead onward to Pusan--& beyond!  Gooooo Army!

(6, 3).clue: An unnatural & unsustainable evolution in digital media is called these creatures "with feet"

(1, 4).clue: In the 1912 election he defeated a sitting president & a former president

(2, 4).clue: (Adam Sandler delivers the clue.)  We produced this 2006 baseball bully revenge movie that starred my friends Rob Schneider, David Spade & Jon Heder

(3, 4).clue: If you have a case of singultus, relax, it's just these spasms of the diaphragm

(4, 4).clue: I love the music of this Polish-French composer, so we must see "In the Night", which features his nocturnes

(5, 4).clue: Bring on the fight!  We are ready to unite!  Victor Emmanuel!  He's the man to give them... grief

(6, 4).clue: A new interval-training workout called "wogging" combines the names of these 2 bipedal activities

(1, 5).clue: At the 1880 GOP Convention, this former 2-term president led on each of the 1st 35 ballots; Garfield was nominated

(2, 5).clue: (Adam Sandler delivers the clue.)  Happy Madison's first feature film was this 1999 comedy that saw Rob Schneider go out on a date with a narcoleptic girl

(3, 5).clue: I see you have flu-like symptoms & a red bull's-eye rash; it could be this tick-borne illness first identified in 1975

(4, 5).clue: If you like cowboys--& cowgirls--you'll love this Agnes de Mille ballet named for a cowboy event

(5, 5).clue: Fight!  Fight!  Fight!  For the blue and white!  We will resist the Russian bear!  Fight on!

(6, 5).clue: An "empty chair interview" occurred on NPR when this "No Spin" guy walked off before the end of the show

(0, 0).clue: The Quadruple Alliance began in 1813 against this country; in 1818 it let this country in & became the Quintuple Alliance
